title.native: デジモンセイバーズ

description:
Masaru, a second year Junior High student and undefeated street-fighter, is about to learn the meaning of the word "teamwork." After Agumon escapes DATS, an organization that deals with Digimon, it winds up in a fight with Masaru. Soon Yoshino and Lalamon come to capture Agumon, and the two fighters escape. After an evil Digimon appears, it's up to Masaru and Agumon to defeat it with their DNA Charge.

Soon, Masaru must join DATS to put an end to the Digimon coming to Earth. With the help of Yoshino, Ikuto, and Touma, the group must stop any evil Digimon that appear, and return them to the Digital World.

But not everything goes as planned...

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Dinosaurs
tags.description: Prominently features Dinosaurs, prehistoric reptiles that went extinct millions of years ago.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

name.native: トーマ・H・ノルシュタイン

node.description: **Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

He's credited on all relevant media as the creator of the original concept and character designs for the virtual pet franchise, Digimon. However, nothing is known about Hongo as an individual.

The name is actually a pseudonym for the three most important figures in the creation of the Digimon franchise: Aki Maita, one of the two creators of the original Tamagotchi; Hiroshi Izawa, the author of the first Digimon manga; and Takeichi Hongo, the director of marketing for Bandai.

(Source: Digimon Wikia)
Racehorse owner and son of the late [Atsushi Yamatoya](https://anilist.co/staff/200012).

[Website](http://wadakoji.com/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/和田光司)

Kouji Wada was best known for performing several songs for the [Digimon](https://anilist.co/anime/552/) series.

On April 3, 2016, he suddenly passed away due to complications related to nasopharynx cancer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

[Website](https://or-lab.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/k1oku)

Graduated from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music.

Director who started off as an animator. Still animates on occasions.

Married to [Sayo Aoi](https://anilist.co/staff/118784/).

Producer and a CG director working for Toei Animation. 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KoichiNoguchi)
